DOC.brief_summary: This study explore influence social environmental factor , stress , nutrition , health status , etc. , woman 's reproductive function . Married Mayan woman 16-42 year age live rural highland Guatemala give birth least one child eligible participate study . Participants interview demographic , social , family , personal , health , reproductive economic situation . They saliva urine sample collect three time week 1 year . Their nutritional health status assess monthly .
DOC.brief_title: Influence Social Environmental Factors Women 's Reproductive Function Maya Community Guatemala
DOC.detailed_description: Background & Objectives : To explore influence social environmental factor woman 's reproductive function . The general hypothesis deterioration quality woman 's reproductive environment ( e.g . psychosocial stress , nutritional status , health status , etc . ) would deleterious effect fecundability early pregnancy maintenance . Study population : Data collect Mayan woman Guatemala . The reduced ethnic socio-economic heterogeneity traditional population , compare industrialized society , increase robustness study design . Inclusion exclusion criterion : The goal evaluate fecundability early pregnancy , thus , woman meet six follow criterion recruit : ( 1 ) cohabitating husband , ( 2 ) , parity great equal 1 ( reduce number infertile participant ) , ( 3 ) 16-42 year age ( woman age great equal 16 consider adult Mayan community . In fact , first two pre-requisite participate woman marry give birth least one child ) , ( 4 ) pregnant onset study ( 5 ) use form contraception , ( 6 ) last birth great six month prior onset study . Human Subject Protection : Participants ' recruitment voluntary . Consent obtain orally participant illiterate , Privacy confidentiality assure , participant inform could discontinue participation time cost consequence . No deception , covert observation , interview child involve . I.D . number ( name ) use record data . Names participant keep separately data . All name data file keep password protect NIEHS-computer CDs store lock key . Only ID number use analysis . Names stored case future research need . We current plant research involve re-contacting participant . Such research would entail separate IRB application . Design outcome parameter : Saliva first-morning urine specimen plus interview data collect every day , total three time week one year . Participants ' stress measure via interview instrument well salivary urinary free cortisol level . Fecundability early pregnancy monitor determination progesterone estrone conjugate , luteinizing follicle stimulate hormone , chorionic gonadotropin . Nutritional health assessment achieve standard medical anthropometric procedure . Lactation , frequency time intercourse , socio-economic status , participant 's life reproductive history assess via interview instrument . The data collection phase project finish . Specimen data analysis continue include assessment stress , fecundability , early pregnancy . Specimen analyse conduct collaborator Dr. Barry G. England University Michigan separate University Michigan IRB approval .
DOC.criteria: ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA : Women meet five follow criterion invite participate : ( 1 ) cohabitating husband , ( 2 ) pregnant onset study , ( 3 ) parity great equal 1 , ( 4 ) use form contraception , ( 5 ) last birth great six month prior onset study .
